solution_line_template: 15 bottles of cola is a cost of {cola_bottles_sold} * {cola_cost_per_bottle} = $<<{cola_bottles_sold}*{cola_cost_per_bottle}={cola_total_cost}>>{cola_total_cost}.
12 bottles of juice make up to {juice_bottles_sold} * {juice_cost_per_bottle} = $<<{juice_bottles_sold}*{juice_cost_per_bottle}={juice_total_cost}>>{juice_total_cost}.

As each of the {water_bottles_sold} sold water bottles was ${water_cost_per_bottle}, the shop made a total of {cola_total_cost} + {juice_total_cost} + {water_total_cost} = $<<{cola_total_cost}+{juice_total_cost}+{water_total_cost}={total_earnings}>>{total_earnings}.
